comments.body: I would love to see our skies get sn update w/ various harmless weather events.
Meteor is from the space
You can already put maps in your offhand
yes that would be nice although it would make the map (tool) a little bit useless so maybee there should be a new feature added to the map (tool) as well then?

I would really like this to be a feature, because it is so easy to get lost in Minecraft, to the point where it is annoying. And maps don't do much to help either as it's only a set amount of space, and not a map of the "whole" world. So, I think regular maps in Minecraft should be used for decoration, and the minimap used for navigation. Or maybe you can craft a minimap, put it in your inventory, and then a minimap will appear in the corner of the screen until it's not in your inventory anymore? Most open world games (Terraria or BOTW for example) have minimaps so you don't get lost so easily, it's annoying having to screenshot places, and then trying to find the exact coordinates for places.

uhh what about horses, etc,

but i think it's a good idea
I think it's good idea, but I think it could be better when you can't deal any damage to your pets (wolfs, cats, parrots) just in that case that the pvp is off.

I like the idea, but I think it should be a game rule as opposed to just something that is always on.

I heftily agree. If we consider how much material goes into making a pressure plate, I think four pressure plates per crafting would be a very conservative amount for the material put into it.

Also, since making normal doors yield three per crafting, that's a 2:1 conversion of material to door, which makes sense, since doors are two blocks tall and all. However, since trapdoors are only one block in width/height, either the conversion should be 1:1 or at least the same as normal doors, meaning either a 6 or 3 yield for trapdoors per crafting, given the same crafting recipe.
I totally agree. If 6 planks makes 3 doors, and trapdoors are half the size of doors, shouldn't 6 planks make 6 trapdoors?

100% agree on all suggestions and reasoning. Trap doors should yield 4-6, plates could easily be 16 with respect to the wooden and stone variants. 2 planks have the same volume as 32 stone or wood plates. Some loss has always made sense to me, but it seems to always catch me by surprise in a new world just how much have to collect to get the amount of what I want - particularly trap doors in my experience.
Its the same for bedrock

I totally agree. If you want to make a slab, they make sure you get two slabs for each block, which makes a lot of sense. But pressure plates require TWO BLOCKS to make one pressure plate, which is less than half the size of a slab, so it doesn't make a lot of sense to me. I think four or six pressure plates for one crafting would be a reasonable amount. 

For trapdoors, the same problem exists. Trapdoors are really expensive. For the same amount of wood require to make a door, you get one less trapdoor than you would a regular door when a trapdoor is half the size. If they keep the crafting recipe the same I feel like six trapdoors would be the right amount for each time you craft it.

So, I did some research (by which I mean I placed a plank next to a pressure plate and compared the two) and a single Minecraft block is exactly 16 pixels tall. A pressure place is exactly one pixel tall, and isn't even a full block around.

One wooden plank is equal to 16 pressure plates, and yet it takes two just to make one. As you said, we don't want it to be too many to be annoying, so I won't ask that we get 32 pressure plates for two blocks, but we should get 16 at least.

In my mods, new wood types give 6 trapdoors instead of 2, pressure plates and buttons will give 4, stairs will always give 8 stairs regardless of material, walls give 2 walls per block in crafting or stone cutting and trapdoors for metal give 1 per ingot.

The trapdoor recipe has always bugged me to an immense degree, especially in relation to slabs; it takes 6 wood planks to make 2 three pixel tall blocks, where as slabs need 3 to make 6 eight pixel tall blocks, it doesn't make sense at all that you can make 12 slabs with the same amount it takes to make 2 trapdoors.

I would give anything for this inconsistency to be fixed, its so annoying whenever i try to build
You do know that custom advancements can be made?

I don't know why this isn't more important. I think it would be a fantastic idea to go to NPC's and see what they have to say. Things to do, like fetch them apples, and things for their jobs. Another funny idea, since you can't understand their language, it'd be funny if you needed to make a potion first to understand them, or an item. Then can interact with the NPC's. It'd bring a lot of life to single player.

It would be very useful in survival.

This has been an issue for years since the windows edition came out and there has not even been any sort of acknowledgement on it, i been wanting to get back into the game but when you run two screens and every time you move around you keep accidentally pressing the taskbar or something on your other screen it gets incredibly frustrating and almost unplayable.

the old java edition does not have this issue at all and locks your cursor to the one screen and as much as id like to play that verison i cant connect to my friends realms that are on the windows edition

I could only hope someone sees this one day, Ive had the same issue where my cursor will fly out of the game and into the title bar and taskbar and clicking will cause the game to reload or open something else up. Truly ridiculous how a game this big has a problem like this since 2017 and wont even acknowledge it. "I have found no solution to this problem and hope Mojang or someone brings attention to this." I'm starting to loose patients.

would like to report that this issue is still a thing. I never had this previously, but it randomly started happening after I toggled fullscreen and now it is permanent on both windowed and fullscreen.

Its Absolutely Insane To Think That This Is Still An issue with no fix. Just appeared on my Minecraft application today. Fullscreen Leaks into Other Monitors looking up/down pauses the game due to interacting with the taskbar/application window. You can't have the game in Fullscreen due to your cursor clicking just barely off the application. This legitimately feels like a novice mistake for a game as large as Minecraft to be doing. Keeping your cursor in the game window when the game is running should be the easiest thing.
The Microsoft leak broke minecraft again and now the PC users are struggling pls fix this jeb
It just started doing it to me today
same issue here please fix it, mouse wont lock

Just started getting this problem today. Tried the lua registry edit thing but it was already enabled. I ""fixed"" it with a steam app/tool called lossless scaling. In the settings for that tool you can make it keep the mouse by enabling "clip cursor" in the menu. Hope this helps

Same thing with me, tried 5-6 different "fixes" but nothing. Seems like a new issue within Minecraft Windows, hopefully they can fix this asap. As it effects windowed and fullscreen mode... awful QA testing something so basic

Minecraft Support responded to my ticket about this issue:
"I see that you are having trouble with your mouse, as it keeps getting off the Minecraft window while playing. I understand that this can be frustrating, and I will do my best to provide the available information and proper guidance to clarify the situation.

I'd like to let you know that this is a known issue the development team is currently working on. Note that as much as we would love to provide you with a solution, this case will need additional investigation time, but our team will respond as soon as we have more information. "

I've had this issue on and off over the years. Now, my husband is having it too! I can't believe that Mojang hasn't figured out how to screen lock the cursor?! We've been so excited to play this new update, but now we'll just have to wait and see if Mojang decides to fix this or ignore it some more.

I don't disagree this Enchantment would be nice to have, I even suggested it when pushing for Bow Fatigue to be brought back, but I hardly think it NEEDS to happen.

I don't know if you've actually tried them out in game, but I would hardly say Bows are worse than Crossbows. I would honestly be amazed if they were.

It feels like everyone against Bow Fatigue is under the impression that your Arrows could fall anywhere within a 5 Block Radius or something.. but that's just not the case, not unless you're shooting at something from a hundred Blocks away or so. If you're firing from a Mid range distance, you might not even notice it.

Anyways, ya still have my Vote, but I think you're being a little extreme.
I don't think bow shaking is an actual matter. I always use my bow for battle and bow shaking is not a real struggle to deal with. However, here, have my vote

I would like to be able to have pixel point accuracy from more than 3 blocks away. It would be nice. This would allow me to accomplish that somewhat. Also, the steadiness enchantment could take out the random factor of the arrow arcs, making it more accurate. It would also work for crossbow and trident, just not as well.

I can suggest a copper compound bow (yes, this is a modern invention, but this can be interpreted as a forgotten invention ahead of its time, like the Antikythera mechanism, the creations of L. Da Vinci)
It can be trophy, or crafted using a trophy blueprint. It won't shake, almost.
